items.content: Feel free to take a look at my latest projects.

about.title: ABOUT ME
about.subtitle: WHO AM I?
about.content:
Hey there! My name is Nguyen Duc Vu Anh, a software engineer currently working at Helius Technology Singapore. I've always been drawn to the excitement of solving complex problems and awesome coding projects. My skills are broad: from front-end design to back-end development. I enjoy each aspect, and love building websites & mobile apps from start to finish, for clients all over the world.

I'm available for remote and freelancing work - if you would like to build something together, get in touch?
about.quote: Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish - Steve Jobs

services.title: WHAT I DO?
services.subtitle: HERE ARE SOME OF MY EXPERTISE

experties.title: Front End
experties.description: I have experience developing web applications using ReactJS and participated in many freelancing projects. The page you are surfing right now was written using ReactJS.

experties.title: Back End
experties.description: I have years of experience designing microservices systems and using Spring Boot to implement the back end of many applications, including databases. Solving difficult problems is fun!

experties.title: Cloud Services
experties.description: I have worked with AWS Services in my projects for more than two years and have received certifications. In fact, I manually deployed this website to AWS.

skills.title: My Specialty
skills.subtitle: My Skills
skills.content: I have been working on various technologies, including back-end and front-end development, but I primarily work with Java and JavaScript. The following bar chart illustrates my years of experience.

items.key: Bachelor Degree of Computer Science at the Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology
items.value: HCMUT is one of the best Engineering universities in Vietnam. I started enrolling in the university in September 2013 and graduated in April 2018. Thanks to the extensive skillsets in Computer Science that I have learned, I managed to get a part-time Java developer job when I was just a 3rd-year student and a full-time job during my 4th year.

IIG is the official TOEIC organizer in Vietnam. Using English fluently has always been my advantage wherever I'm working. I am confident that my skills in English will prove valuable when working with clients from around the globe.

items.key: A Grade Certificate of Global Software Talent Training course issued by FPT Software
items.value: FPT Software is one of the most popular outsourcing companies in Vietnam. Even though the course only lasted for one semester, at the end of it, my team managed to develop a fully functional web application and successfully present it in front of the judges. Through the course, I learned about the progress of a software project how to write documents, draw diagrams, and present them to potential clients.
The PSM I Certificate is the standard certification to prove my knowledge and understanding of Scrum and the role of the Scrum Master.

items.key: Professional Scrum Product Owner I (PSPO I)
items.value: The PSPO I Certificate is the standard certification to assess my ability to evaluate, create and deliver value when creating a product.

The AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner helps organizations identify and develop talent with critical knowledge related to implementing cloud initiatives. Earning AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner validates cloud fluency and foundational AWS knowledge.
IELTS is the high stakes English test for international study, migration and work.

items.title: Full time student at the Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology
items.content: I graduated from one of the best universities in Vietnam for engineering students, majoring in Computer Science and Engineering.

items.title: Full Stack Developer Intern at SmartEduNow
items.content: Responsible for creating clean, comprehensive, and executable code both front-end and back-end.

items.title: Software Engineer at Sutrix Solutions
items.content: This is the first company I worked at as a full-time employee. During the two years of working here, I had the opportunity to work on multi-million dollar projects. I was responsible for optimizing the application to meet the demands of my clients. I learned new technologies from this company, how to communicate professionally, and soft skills.

items.title: Software Engineer at KMS Technology
items.content: KMS Technology is one of the leading software companies in Vietnam. At this company, my team and I implemented an entire car insurance infrastructure from scratch. We deployed it to AWS, with me responsible for writing key features and presenting the work to Onshore Clients in the US. I also managed a small team (4 members) that contributed significantly to the grand team.

items.title: Software Engineer at NAB
items.content: Regarding market capitalization, earnings and customers, NAB is one of Australia's four most prominent financial institutions (colloquially referred to as 'The Big Four'). At this bank, I am one of the key members of a brand-new team that works entirely on Java Spring Boot and AWS. The product involves managing the personal card of the bank's clients (credit card, debit, etc)

items.title: Senior Software Engineer (Contractor of Helius) at Equinix Singapore
items.content: Equinix is an American multinational company headquartered in Redwood City, California, specializing in Internet connection and data centers. The company is a leader in global colocation data center market share. At this corporate, I maintain and develop new features, fix security concerns, and resolve production issues as the Support Champion.

projects.title: Smart Education System
responsibilities: This was the first project in my professional career as a programmer. At the time of working, I was a 3rd-year student. My primary responsibilities were observing and learning from otherseniors, getting familiar with an actual project's processes, and implementing simple features.The project helped me understand what is expected from a good programmer and what I must learn and improve before sailing to the ocean.
accomplishments: Gained basic knowledge of what is expected of a software engineer.

projects.title: Qatar Tourism
projects.description: Qatar's Ministry of Tourism's main website serves as the strategic marketing tool and online services of the Ministry of Tourism.
responsibilities: I was tasked to implement easy to intermediate features such as simple APIs or straightforward business logic in this project. During my time working on the project, my coding skills were greatly improved thanks to my former Team Leader's guidance, who helped review and optimize my work.
accomplishments: Gained basic knowledge on how to write software professionally (how to properly structure the project, write unit tests, and present ideas and solutions to the team leader).

projects.title: Fonterra - Edetailing
projects.description: Fonterra's internal application to market their products.
responsibilities: In this project, I was tasked to develop many essential features. I was also responsible for presenting the team's accomplishments to the client throughout each Sprint cycle. Thanks to that, I earned the trust of my manager and team leaders, eventually getting me promoted to Java Team Leader.
accomplishments: Got promoted to Java Team Leader

projects.title: Lexis Nexis Insurance - Telematrics
projects.description: Car insurance management server that serves many car models and customers from many regions, including the US and Europe, will expand to Asia soon.
responsibilities: My main tasks include developing and taking responsibility for crucial infrastructure features (business logic, authentication/authorization, etc.) and using Terraform/Terragrunt to deploy them to AWS. I was also tasked to manage a sub-team of members to deliver specifically assigned business logic and present the work to US clients when required.
accomplishments: After the AWS instances were up and running, it managed to handle 20 million customer data within 8 hours, which was many times better than the existing infrastructure (decommissioned).
I managed to convince my manager to allow me to lead a small team (4 members), which performed many successful production deployments.
technologies: Amazon Web Services (S3, SQS, DynamoDB, SNS, EC2, Fargate, Parameter Store, ECR)

projects.title: NAB - Personal Cards
projects.description: Back-end system for personal cards managing.
responsibilities: My main tasks include developing and taking responsibility for crucial infrastructure features (business logic, authentication/authorization, etc.) and cooperating with DevOps to deploy them to AWS.
accomplishments: I took the lead in implementing the new versions (V2) of many of NAB's existing APIs. For each new implementation, I used the optimized features of Java 8 and 11 (like Stream APIs, Function Interfaces, and Completable Futures).
I also made sure all the V2 APIs have better performance compared to the existing versions (V1) by generating performance reports with Gatling

projects.title: Equinix - Customer Resource Hierarchy
projects.description: Back-end system that serves as a portal for customers to manage their resources.
responsibilities: My main tasks include developing and taking responsibility for crucial infrastructure features and working directly with Singapore colleagues. I also took on leading duties in fixing the security concerns of the services.
accomplishments: I took the lead in fixing the security concerns of the services (including insecure 3rd party dependencies and public APIs exposing sensitive content, and properly sanitized the input data before processing).
I helped increase the overall unit test coverage of all the services to at least 81%.
As a Support Champion, I've successfully resolved many production issues (especially P1) and extracted production instances' availability reports daily.
